title: Bug 7581 - ComboBoxCellEditor does not size correctly in property sheet
description:
From ECJoe Winchester <JoeWin@us.ibm.com>:

The ComboBoxCellEditor does not size correctly in the property sheet.
The issue occurs when the ComboBoxCellEditor is used in the property sheet view.
The ComboBoxCellEditor does not expand to fit the content of the drop-down list, causing truncation or clipping of the items.
This behavior makes it difficult for users to select the desired option in the drop-down list.

This bug report aims to address this sizing issue in the ComboBoxCellEditor within the property sheet view.
OB: The ComboBoxCellEditor does not size correctly in the property sheet. When the ComboBoxCellEditor is used in the property sheet view, it does not expand to fit the content of the drop-down list. As a result, the items in the drop-down list are truncated or clipped. This behavior makes it challenging for users to select the desired option.
EB: The ComboBoxCellEditor in the property sheet view should expand or size itself properly to accommodate the content of the drop-down list. This will ensure that all items in the drop-down list are fully visible to the users, allowing them to easily select the desired option.
SR:
To reproduce:
1. Open the property sheet view.
2. Select a property that uses the ComboBoxCellEditor.
3. Observe the size of the drop-down list.
4. Add enough items to the drop-down list to cause scrolling or truncation.
5. Notice that the ComboBoxCellEditor does not expand to show all items in the drop-down list properly.
